channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023080058
item.description:
Report X-2023080058

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: PRESCOTT
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded when found to be wet. line was stopped, package was placed in lined haz tote and isolated in hazmat cage. DescribePack: appears that lids were loose and had slight leak. all internal cans had "dented/crushed" bottoms. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: pakcage was ioslated in lined hazmat tote and taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070274
item.description:
Report X-2023070274

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE LOAD WALL. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER IDENTIFIED SAID LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER PLACED SAID PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY, CLEANED UP LEAKED OUT LIQUID, AND TRANSPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023071167
item.description:
Report X-2023071167

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the south unload leaking and was placed into a hazmat bag and taken to QA to be processed. DescribePack: 2 Bottles were crushed together which caused liquid to leak out and damaged the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat bag was placed into a white pail and into the hazmat cage waiting for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023070981
item.description:
Report X-2023070981

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: the package had a soiled base which cause for the inspection. The box was placed in the appropriate tote and bag and taken to the cage to be inspected. DescribePack: one of the corners were a little crushed which then loosened the lid or caused a small air pocket and soiled the contents. DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: the proper personnel was alerted. the package was placed in the appropriate hazardous materials tote and bag for further inspection.

Report X-2023070977

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Packa arrived at QA with closures opened causing spillage of powder content. We placed the package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum. DescribePack: Package was not closed correctly, the lid was loose causing spillage of powder content DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package in a hazmat bag then in a yellow drum.

item.title: Report X-2023070975
item.description:
Report X-2023070975

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet, on a van line. Ops manager was informed and brought the package to the hazmat cage at 5:00am. DescribePack: One of the gallons seal under the bottle cap is corroded slightly, causing an opening (and subsequent leakage). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package put into a lined, red, hazmat tote and placed under the vent hood in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070948
item.description:
Report X-2023070948

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: YUMA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was sent up the belt, when it began to leak. Package was immediately placed inside a hazmat tote in the upright position to prevent further leakage and taken to QA for inspection and processing. DescribePack: Package contained 4x1 Gallons. One of those gallons cap had fallen off and thus caused the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Packages was immediately placed inside a tote in the upright position to prevent any further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2023070908
item.description:
Report E-2023070908

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 50 pound bags of phycomycin (UN3378) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 pounds of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
